page.title: 18 Employment in Radcot area
page.content: Thames Water employs men at the Lock, there is a one-man car repair business associated with a farm and the public house provides work for four people. Other than this farming is the only source of employment. In addition to the farming families, a dozen people are employed on the farms. Women find domestic work in the larger houses. The economy of the area is enhanced by the tourist trade. There are 3 Caravan Club Sites, one a farm site in Thrupp, the other 2 are riverside sites. In addition a large riverside rally site has space for about 60 caravans, rallies are held on most alternate weekends. This site is attractively laid out with Cricket Bat Willows planted to mark out individual pitches. There are moorings for about 75 motor cruisers along the Thames and it's backwaters, around the bridge.
